Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Elaine Rosamond Hooper  Elaine Hooper
Instructor: Elaine Rosamond Hooper  Elaine Hooper
Instructor: Elaine Rosamond Hooper  Elaine
Instructor: Elaine Rosamond Hooper  Elaine Hooper:She was excellent in providing comments and feedback during the course, and always available to answer questions.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Q14: This course provides a wonderful outlet for working on writing up one's research in a structured setting. A research student can always work on their papers on their own, but I found this course much more valuable.
NA

Overall this class was helpful in focusing me more on my goals. However, occasionally it was frustrating because I felt pushed into writing parts of my research that I would have preferred to write after I know more about what my results and discussion will look like.
Question 13: Overall, I enjoyed the course very much and found it to be very useful.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: (1) Having deadlines imposed that motivated the lengthy analysis and writing process.(2) Having to present on a regular basis. Though I came into the course dreading this, it ended up being one of my favorite parts. It forced me to solidify my presentation skills and overcome the anxieties associated with that process.(3) A friendly, supportive environment for developing ones research.
Practicing a committee review for a paper, presenting portions of research.
Frequent feedback from classmates, professor, and TA.
It was helpful being able to practice giving scientific talks and to receive feedback on your research.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: I am not sure there is much about this course that needs improving. It gave me exactly what I needed, and like its current format very much.

Review guidance was unclear, sometimes it would be nice to have more guidance on writing and presenting the review paper before it was actually due/completed, so we could have an idea of what people are looking for. I don't think any of us have been first author on a paper before.
The course was excellent as is and needs no improvement.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: N/A
NA

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Elaine Rosamond Hooper  The teaching assistant always provided thoughtful feedback on student work, both in class and by email. She was timely, engaged, and insightful. While I did not interact with her as much as I could have, she provided excellent support and made herself available as students needed.
Instructor: Elaine Rosamond Hooper  She was very helpful and always available for questions. She provided excellent feedback on papers and presentations. Nothing can be improved.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This course provided an extremely valuable opportunity to gain practice communicating research. Getting feedback from Mark and the other students was helpful in improving my science communication skills.

This course provided an alternative to independent research credits where I could focus on writing up and presenting my summer research while also supporting and being supported by other students doing the same. This course provided a useful outlet for preparing me for conference presentations.
This course helped me to refine my scientific writing and presentation skills for my master's thesis, as well as for my future career.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: See Question 20.
I wanted to enhance my scientific writing and speaking abilities to better communicate with the public about my findings.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes; I feel that I improved greatly over the semester and have a much better understanding of how to be an effective communicator.
Yes. This course was just as I expected to be, though I found more enjoyment in it than I originally anticipated.
Yes, although I thought there would be more writing hints and practice, like how to write a methodology or tips for writing results, and less presenting the same thing multiple times.
Yes, most certainly.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: The work group allowed me to focus my energy on a smaller body of work, allowing me to to both provide and receive more constructive critiques than would otherwise have been possible. When writing for a wider audience, it is always useful to have a large number of people read drafts of your work. The work groups provided an outlet for this.
Very helpful to do the peer review, especially since by the end we were quite familiar with each other's research.
Additional one-on-one feedback for this class was useful. Also, it was nice to discuss our projects without the pressure of having the Professor and TA also critiquing you at that time.
It was helpful to peer-review each other's papers and to receive additional feedback.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: (1)If you plan to pursue analysis and writing of your summer research over the course of the year, this class provides a great opportunity to do that with others. There is no need to sign up for more independent research credits.(2) For those who are feeling nervous about giving presentations at conferences or the FES research colloquiums, this course will provide a supportive environment to help you work through your presentation hang-ups and leave with you greater comfort and style.(3) This course requires self-direction. Deadlines are widely space, and it is important to plan accordingly to ensure you are making continual progress on your work.
Very helpful if you haven't published a first author paper before.
I would recommend they practice as much as possible to make their presentations better and listen to the constructive feedback given throughout the course to improve their writing.
